Subjective: Bilateral eye irritation and redness. Started Tuesday morning in one eye, became redder. Second eye became red yesterday. Constant foreign body sensation, like a hair or dust. Affected eye feels 'thicker'. Mild pain only on forceful squeezing of eyes. Eyes 'a bit stuck' in the morning. No vision changes, no photophobia, no purulent discharge. No known trauma or foreign body. No new cosmetics (mascara, cream). No systemic illness, fever, or flu symptoms. Has a young daughter. Boyfriend is away. Concern if it is contagious or something serious. Request: Check eye, confirm diagnosis, and advise on need for drops or antibiotics.
Objective: Visual Inspection: Bilateral conjunctival injection (redness). No foreign body visualized on lower or upper eyelid eversion. Eyelashes normal. Pupils are equally reactive to light.
Plan: 1. Reassurance: Explained as viral inflammation of the eye surface, which is self-limiting. May take up to 2 weeks to resolve. 2. Advice: Avoid rubbing eyes. Rinsing is not necessary. May use OTC artificial tears for soothing/irritation. May clean morning crusting with a cotton pad and lukewarm tap water. 3. Safety Netting: Return immediately for increased pain, development of pus, worsening vision, or if eyes become more stuck shut. 4. Follow-up: Return in 2 weeks if symptoms have not resolved.
